lead_paragraph: The Greek government has agreed to austerity measures totaling about $32 billion that will include cutting some jobs as well as opening up parts of the economy.
snippet: The Greek government has agreed to austerity measures totaling about $32 billion that will include cutting some jobs as well as opening up parts of the economy.

headline.main: The Bitter Pills in the Plan to Rescue Greece
headline.seo: Plan to Rescue Greek Economy Appears Near
headline.print_headline: The Bitter Pills In the Plan To Rescue Greece

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and LANDON THOMAS Jr
byline.contributor: Dan Bilefsky reported from Athens and Landon Thomas Jr. from London. Stelios Bouras contributed reporting from Athens, James Kanter from Brussels and John Vinocur from Berlin.
